meanings.definition: Payment or profit arising from employment or office.
meanings.sent1: The hardworking employee received an emolument for his work at the company.
meanings.sent2: She was happy to see an increase in her emolument after getting a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The emolument he received was like a reward for his dedication to the job.
meanings.sent4: Her emolument was a tangible recognition of her contribution to the organization.
meanings.sent5: The emolument served as a motivation for him to excel in his role.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food is an emolument for your overall well-being.
meanings.sent2: One of the emoluments of reading is gaining knowledge and expanding your vocabulary.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected discount at the store felt like a little emolument for the long day.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful surroundings of the park provided a much-needed emolument from the city noise.
meanings.sent5: The emolument of having a supportive friend is priceless during tough times.
